captions.text: I am coming from a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.
That means, my father is a handloom weaver,
my mother is a farm worker.
I am studying up to only 9th standard.
I am trying to speak my own English.
Maybe verbs, and tense may be missed
I know being educated people you can all tell
in good English
Upto 1998, I was housebound husband; that is all. Ok.
My world is my Shanti (wife), and my mother
and my small workshop - working as a helper in a workshop.
One day in 1998, I sat at my house, after taking lunch and relaxing,
I saw my wife carrying something like this, to hide (from) me.
Then as a housebound husband I asked her, “What is that?”
She answered me like slapping on my cheeks (insult), “It is none of your business.”
Then, being a husband I saw a very nasty cloth, a rag cloth.
Even I don’t use that cloth to clean my two-wheeler (bike).
Then, I understand that she is adopting that unhygienic method
to manage  the period days.
Then I asked my wife, why, (when) there are sanitary napkins,
you are using that unhygienic methods.
She replied immediately, “I also know there is sanitary napkins, I am watching tv.”
But, if  myself and other women in our family start using napkins,
we have to cut our family milk budget,” she replied.
I shocked.. What is the connection between sanitary napkins and cutting the milk budget?
Then I understood, it’s a cost factor. .
Then the same day I went to a shop. Then I tried to buy a sanitary napkin packet.
Then the shop walla (shop-keeper) asked what brand you want.
Who knows what brand and all. Just I finger out (pointed out to) a packet,
beautiful packet inside their showcase. I bought the packet--the research started..
Being a workshop helper, whatever I took in my hand,
my brain tells the weight of the object.
Napkin weight, what I took out of the packet, I think less than 10 grams.
Being a Coimbaturian (native of Coimbatore), there are 500 textile mills are there.
Those days that 10 gram cotton price is only 10 paise, that means like 10 cents.
The multinational using only 10  paise raw material, they are selling for 4 rupees.
You just think the fold... profit fold (profit margin).
Then I want to make... I am damn sure I can make a low cost napkin.
The main thing is I need a woman volunteer. Where I can go?
The only available choice, the victim is my wife.
Then, I bought the ..sanitary.. cotton in a reputed mill.
I made a sanitary napkin and I give it to my Shanti.
“I want a feedback immediately.”
You see, whatever I make differently,
I’ll tell, “Shanti close your eyes and I put in her hand.” This time, I’m doing the same.
Shanti is opening eyes, she saw a napkin.
She shocked. “Oh, you entered in this field now.”
“Yes, I want a feedback.” “It's not possible to do. You will have to wait for some time.”
Then only I understand, oh, period means monthly once.
Even now, so many adults don’t know what the problems the ladies are facing.
Then, I go back my workshop duty. Then, after 15 days,
I am getting the feedback for my napkin.
“What napkin you gave it to me? It is very nasty.
I'll go back to my cloth using method," (says his wife, Shanti).
Then, I need more volunteers. It is not possible to make a napkin
and waiting for a month to get feedback. It will take 2 decades to make a napkin.
Then, I need more volunteers. Then, other available victims are my sisters.
Even a wife and sisters, they are not ready to talk on this subject.
Whenever, I step into my sister's home, they immediately call my wife,
“Ask Anna (older brother) don’t come to my home to talk about this subject.”
Then, I got an idea. Why not we contact medical college girls (students).
But how can a workshop helper approach medical college girls?
Even college boys are not able to go near and ask all these girls.
How can workshop helper go near medical college girls?
Somehow I managed to get something.
The same, I think, giving various napkins, and wait for 4-5 days.
Then feedback….then, I realized even the future doctors, the girls,
they are not ready to discuss about the  subject with an adult.
Then, I got an idea, why not give a feedback sheet?
So these are all the terms I am pronouncing now.
10 years before I don’t know the feedback sheet and all.
I only know cycle seat.
There I made a small small questions, what I want to ask.
Then they have to fill. Those days, 20 girls helping me.
I supply a napkin, I wait for a week. On a particular day,
I’m  going to collect the feedback sheet.
I saw in front of that hostel, only 3 girls are very urgently filling
the feedback sheet for the rest of them.
It's a false one. A false - so what can I do?
So, how can I conduct further more on false feedback sheet.
Then I took a (cup of) tea in front of medical college.
Then I think, hereafter, it is not good depending on the girls.
Why not check myself the napkin. Then, this happened..
now the history is coming. A man wore sanitary napkin.
somebody in the English paper were writing in the half page
That means, I actually use short type underwear.
Those days I bought a triangular shape underwear. I wore a sanitary napkin.
In a football bladder, there is animal blood,
with mixture and all, there is a tube.
While I walking and cycling, I’ll press one dose will go to the napkin.
This way I checked. But, then also I was not satisfied.
So these are all.. these steps are happening, the days are going,
months are going…6 months.. 8 months.. 9 months.. So what.. almost a year.
But, my thing is, why my napkin is not working with ladies and girls?
The company ones are working--both are cotton.
In the meantime, I am sending the company napkin's material
to various labs across India.They are also telling,
we declare we found inside is a cotton filament and cellulose substance.
They are various names for the cotton. But, I’m using cotton,
why is it not working, that is my question.
So in between, what happened you know? Those days, people will suspect,
I have become a psycho. I have become a mad.
First my wife separated from me.  She sent a divorce notice to me.
Then, I got a very peculiar idea. Taking feedbacks become a risk one.
Then, I got a risky idea. Instead of asking feedback, this that and all,
why not I can ask a used napkin from a girl. You think the risk.
Even (If) I ask (for) hair from a lady, she will suspect
I’m going do some black magic on her to mesmerize.
In india they won't give even the foot print of that soil to take.
Then, I somehow managed to get some used napkins from the ladies.
I spread all this in the backyard of my room, 10 by 10 room.
I am researching on that. And those days my mother is coming back.
I never realize this, Sunday I think. She thought,
because already wife is gone, separated from me, because of research.
My mother thinks his son is cleaning chicken for Sunday.
The moment (she) came and saw substance on the table,
nothing she did, she cried like anything.
Somebody did on my son something, he’s totally become mad.
Mahalakshmi (goddess of wealth) going to go out of my home.
Because in south, they will put cowdung everywhere in nook and corner of the home,
they will put agarbatti (incense), sambrani  (aromatic gum),
smoke, everything. It's like Mahalakshmi’s place.
In that house, I put this substance, she also separated from me.
Then, problem for food. I have to cook myself.
So, anyway, I succeeded. I realized what is that material  inside.
The cotton is from flower, it is from the bark of the tree---that's all.
It’s very simple. The cellulose is derived from the bark of the tree.
It's called wood pulp. But, even after finding that--you need that big plant.
(It) costs around 3.5 crore (700,000 USD) to make the sanitary napkin.
That’s why from the second World War, this field in the hand of multinationals only.
Even after seeing the plant, I’m never discouraged.
I further researched for four and half years.
and I made a small small machine like this.
I made world class napkin at my home. This is my innovation.
Then, I send it to IIT (Indian Institute of Technology) for evaluation.
Those days, I’m trying to patent. Because, little bit I’m getting
learning.. learning.. learning.. and become skilled, I understood IPR rights.
I spend a lot.. not only money, family, everything.
Then, those days, there is a small competition is going on in IIT Madras,
there is called ‘Best Innovation for the betterment of society.’
Without telling me, they involve this innovation in the competition.
Around 943 entries, it become first.
Suddenly I'm (in) the limelight.
Then everybody writing. The workshop helper did this.. that work.
Then I got the patent rights also.
This is the only unique product around the globe
to make sanitary napkin at low cost machine.
You think about the hot cake product. Ok. This machine.
So what you will do if you have such type of product in your hand?
I’m asking you any MBA students or business persons here.
You try to use your IPR rights to maximum accumulation of money.
But I never did this, why?
From the childhood, I know, no human being died because of poverty.
Everything happens because of ignorance.
So, ignorance means what you know?
Just chasing this money.
Everybody was chasing this money.
I never studied in business school or anything.
I just observing people what they are doing.
If I ask in the crowd what you are doing in you life,
definitely I know only two.. you, everybody.. trying to survive
wearing coat or doing this business, that business, this, that,
apartment Rolls Royce, Benz. Finally…
you are just surviving in a small way,
in a small apartment, an apartment with extra bedroom, a bungalow, that’s all.
Nothing more than that. Am I right or right? You have to agree.
Not more than that.
The problem is if you want to brush your teeth,
you need a nylon handle and nylon brush is sufficient.
What happened in the mind, once you go further in your life, you need …
a gold plated and diamond ring (on) this toothbrush.
Then, agree  or not.
This is the stupidness that happens around the globe. Ok.
So I never did. So, I don’t want to do business like this,
only profit.. profit.. profit.. seeing books for millions billions.
I am doing as a social cause,
I am giving the machines to the rural India.
The back view of the plant.
These women are making napkins.
So my mission is,  I am going to create not less than
a million employments for rural women.
By the way, I am going to create a India
only 7% penetration is there. 93% of women are not using napkin.
I am going to make that figure into 100%.
I am going to provide 1 million employment creation through this.
That is my vision. That is what I am going to do.
Thank you very much.
Bye!

title: Arunachalam Muruganantham: The first man to wear a sanitary napkin
